Message:
Little A asked me that question
after I let her read a book.

She has no clue what the sky is
because she’s never set foot
outside the laboratory.

I showed her some photographs,
but that just added to
her bewilderment.

No amount of words or
photographs can convey how
blue and beautiful the sky is.

After staring at the collections
of blue ink for a while,

she looked up at the laboratory
ceiling and muttered in curiousity,

“I sure hope you can see
the real sky one day.”

“That would be nice,” she replied,
her emotionless eyes trembling
ever so slightly.

Is there any way to
show Little A the sky?

If I learned of a witch
who could control light,
I went to ask them if they’d
make a sky for Little A.

If I got word of a book with
beautiful photographs of the sky,
I procured it at once.

and I spend more time exclusively
on these “experiments.”
By the time I realized it,

she was the only thing
I could think about.
